resources.string: The contrast ratio is often not given enough attention in the development of mobile apps. However, especially in mobile use, a good contrast ratio is important for all users, e.g. when using mobile devices outdoors in sunshine. Below you will find some examples of good and bad contrast ratios.
Passed with contrast ratio of? HEX #ffffff on #006400
In this example, the alternative text was intentionally omitted. In practice, it happens very often that the alternative text is omitted by mistake.
In this example, the graphic was assumed to be purely decorative and the alternative text was left blank so that TalkBack ignores the graphic and does not output unnecessary text.
In this example, the graphic was assumed to be informative, so it was provided with an alternative text.

In the following, we will show how TalkBack behaves when the visually visible labels have not been linked to the corresponding input field. In order to link the visible labels with the corresponding input fields, the attribute android:labelFor=\" \" is used for the label with the belonging editText\'s ID as value.
In the first input field, the link to the visible label was intentionally omitted. The second is correctly linked to the label.
Press the button below to display the full name.
The current version of WCAG is 2.1.
The current version was released in june 2018.
What is the current version of WCAG?
When was the current version of WCAG released?
This example shows how TalkBack behaves with graphic buttons that lack alternative text, and at the same time shows how the buttons can be made more usable for people with limited fine motor skills.

In the first graphic button, the alternative text, the attribute contentDescription=\" \" was intentionally omitted and the font target was also not adjusted. The second graphic button, however, was correctly labelled and the touch target was adjusted by setting the attributes minWidth and minHeight to 48dp so that the button is displayed larger and is thus easier to use.
Question #1: What is the current version of WCAG?
Question #2: When was the current version of WCAG released?
Get the answer to the second question.
Oops, something went wrong with the tab order.
Now the tab order is correct.

There is a difference in headings between native apps and hybrids with embedded HTML content. While there are six levels of headings in HTML h1 to h6, this is not the case with native apps. In native apps, the attribute android:accessibilityHeading \"tue\" is used to mark up a text (textView) on a non-visual level as a heading.
Failed with contrast ratio of? HEX #ffffff on #ffbb86fc

The following will show what is read by TalkBack in the three most common situations (no alternative text, decorative graphics, and informative graphics). To provide an alternative text to graphics the attribute android:contentDescription=\" \" is used.

People with limited fine motor skills may not be able to operate a touch screen. It is therefore important that an app can also be operated with a keyboard connected via Bluetooth and that the focus order of the operating elements is correct.
In the first example, the focus order was intentionally ignored, but in the second example, the focus order is correct
Passed with 21.0:1, HEX: # f f f f f f on #000000.
Failed with 2.3:1, HEX: # f f f f f f on #a0b0a1.
Just failed with 4.4:1, HEX: # f f f f f f on #0083a1
Failed with contrast ratio of? HEX # f f f f f f on #ffbb86fc
Passed with contrast ratio of? HEX # f f f f f f on #006400
"The app \"A Demonstration\" does not store any data permanently (not even on the device) or pass it on to third parties. "
There are two forms is the app, however this are just mock forms. The data that you entered in this forms are only displayed on the same screen and wil be not stored.
